paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses variants in the TTR gene associated with transthyretin amyloid cardiomyopathy (ATTR-CM) and provides penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: During a median follow-up period of 3.7 years, 38 patients developed HF symptoms.
77 patients remained in NYHA functional class I.

functional_data.summary: The V30M variant is associated with increased risk of developing heart failure.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families with a history of ATTR-CM.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical outcomes.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the importance of early diagnosis and treatment in variant carriers.
key_quotes: 1 in 3 patients with asymptomatic ATTR-CM developed HF symptoms.
Treatment with TTR stabilizers was associated with improved prognosis.

tables_processed.table_caption: Baseline Characteristics of the Total Cohort and According to ATTR-v and ATTR-wt

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding TTR variants and penetrance were successfully extracted.
